meanings.sent1: The rubber band recoils when you stretch it and let go.
meanings.sent2: The ball recoils off the wall when thrown with force.
meanings.sent3: The cat recoils playfully when you try to tickle its belly.
meanings.sent4: His heart recoils from the idea of jumping off a high cliff.
meanings.sent5: The metal spring recoils with a satisfying twang when released.

meanings.definition: To shrink back, as in fear or repugnance.
meanings.sent1: She recoils in horror at the sight of the creepy crawly spider.
meanings.sent2: He recoils from the dark alley, sensing danger lurking within.
meanings.sent3: The child recoils comically from the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent4: The idea of failure recoils in his mind like a dark shadow.
meanings.sent5: The character recoils dramatically from the villain's outstretched hand.

meanings.sent1: The recoil of the gun was strong, pushing him back.
meanings.sent2: The recoil of the spring-loaded door surprised the unsuspecting visitor.
meanings.sent3: The recoil of the joke left everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The recoil of the car crash was felt throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The recoil of the slingshot sent the pebble flying into the distance.
